technologyQuarter.name: A Novel AR Game for Spatial Ear-training
technologyQuarter.description: We present a novel spatial ear training program using a head-mount AR display. In a game format, the user is asked to indicate the perceived location of the target sound. The proximity of the indicated location to the actual target is converted into scores. Multiple levels of difficulty take users to proceed from the easiest level to the most difficult. This system is expected helpful for those who want to develop better spatial mapping, including sound engineers and new cochlear implant users.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Song Hui Chon, Sungyoung Kim, Justin Levine

technologyQuarter.name: A Walk Through Emergencies
technologyQuarter.building: Center for Bioscience Education and Technology
technologyQuarter.description: An interestingly insightful look into the human body and how the smallest things can create chaos. Our booth is here to help you manage the chaos and be a helpful member of the community.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: James Bice, Alexandra Mace, Rafael Ortega, Lauren Naoolitano, Sara Keller, Gabby Frumusa, Maria Zepeda, Wendy Qu, Elaine Dolan, Anika Aftab, David Hartman, Hanh Huynh, Gurpinder Dhaliwal, Ajnur Sljivo, Hannah Weppner, Jacob Zukoski

technologyQuarter.name: Army ROTC Table Display
technologyQuarter.description: Join us outside the Engineering Technology Hall where we'll have information about ROTC!

technologyQuarter.name: Breathalyzer
technologyQuarter.description: We will ask visitors to breathe into a balloon. We will use a syringe to sample the air in the balloon and inject it into a gas chromatograph. The result will be displayed on a computer monitor. Visitors will be offered the opportunity to use mouthwash to create a result if they have been sober too long to get a measurable alcohol test result.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Holly Stiner, Grant Esler, Michael McGuinness, Corey Rapp, Joshua Pinals, Neil Kelly

technologyQuarter.name: DNA Necklaces
technologyQuarter.building: Center for Bioscience Education and Technology
technologyQuarter.description: Patrons will be invited to vigorously rinse their oral cavity with a sterile solution to dislodge epithelial cells for 30 seconds and then expectorate back into a sterile 50 ml tube. Afterwards a series of solutions will be added one at a time with gentle mixing. Once the patron's epithelial cells are lysed, the released DNA will then be further isolated by precipitation and finally placed into a jewelry quality glass container. The final product will be a glass jewelry quality DNA necklace.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Rebecca Fletcher Roberts, Robert Osgood, Olivia Williams, Joyce Murphy, Andrew Salamino, Asante Jessica, Sofia Rehman, Abby Melake, Abbey Snow, Fikirte Adella, Jessica Metelski, Claire Teal, Caitlin Pope, Sama Alnassiry, Ashley Bonney, Celina Koh, David Hartman, Emily Collins, Kenneth Nickels, Rachel Fasiczka, Victoria Utz, Karnan Rajkumar, Ma'Kiah Holliday, Valerie Coleman, Emilyn Nguyen

technologyQuarter.name: Electric Wooden Go-Cart
technologyQuarter.description: A wooden car machined and constructed from the ground up. Electrically powered, possesses a Raspberry Pi powered display, and composed of a variety of parts that were machined by group members. Designed to resemble a classic go kart.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Scott Williamson, Emerson Maloney, Mia Sitzler, Daniel Yochim, David Wilson, Carl Burkhard, Michael Smith, Christian Kobb, Kimberly Scheer, Sara Zuwiyya, Luke Murphy, Chris Witmer, Amanda Lydick, Benjamin Keylock, Kimberly Bernetski

technologyQuarter.name: Green Energy Team
technologyQuarter.description: This exhibit has an interactive set up that has a solar panel, wind turbine, & fuel cell that has active voltage values displayed. Visitors will be educated about alternative energy that is going to be integral part of the future of the world. We will show visitors ways that they can improve their own homes & save money on energy costs.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Holly Stiner, Sean Blackey, Shola Olabisi, James Kommeth, Jenny Bober , David Simpson , Jonah Zuckerman , Kuanju Chen, Sarah White, Peter Dililberto

technologyQuarter.name: Grocery List with a Twist
technologyQuarter.building: Center for Bioscience Education and Technology
technologyQuarter.description: Combine grocery shopping, nutrition, and technology to make the best choices about what to eat for your lifestyle. Your adventure begins at our IMAGINE Market, where you will 'shop' for your favorite food items. Next, learn how your choices stack up nutritionally using a mobile app and play our fun Food Twister game.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Elizabeth Ruder, Michael Cummings, Sarah Graham, Nina Hullett, Laura Masisak, Ashley Nguyen, Alyssa Riley, Amy Stevens, Samantha Teneyck, Brianna Williams, Elizabeth Kmiecinski

technologyQuarter.name: Immerse Yourself with the Future of 3D Sound
technologyQuarter.description: Come and 'see' the 3D sound that wraps around you! Media technologies have evolved towards 'tangible' and 'immersive' user experiences. In this exhibition, the presenter and student workers will present the latest and state-of-the-art audio technologies that will provide visitors with 'tangible' and 'immersive' sound. Please come and immerse yourself with the 22.2-channel sound for UHDTV, and virtual music performance.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Sungyoung Kim, Ryan Mraz, Daniel Fehrenbach, Jerome Glick, Jonathan Crawford, Ryan Vickers, Steve Brisbois

technologyQuarter.name: Korean Webtoon Display
technologyQuarter.description: Introducing new snack culture created in South Korea.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Daeseong Oh, Sharon Im, Kyunghwan Sul, Seohyun Kim, Evelyn Seung Yeon Cho, Simon Donghyun Kim

technologyQuarter.name: RIT Team Baja SAE Cars Display
technologyQuarter.description: The Baja SAE cars are off-road vehicles that must be capable of surviving and excelling on a course consisting of rough terrain and jumps. This year's cars will be on display and team members will be on hand to answer questions about the cars.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Holly Stiner, Martin Gordon, Aaron Reay, Doug Botto, Liz Harvey, Justin Neves, Asif Habib, Nathan McKerley, Ellory Lane, Peter Bruschi, Abbey Jo Leyendecker, Kaitlyn Wolford, Ryan Wager

technologyQuarter.name: SAE Clean Snowmobile
technologyQuarter.description: The Clean Snowmobile Team will be showcasing their 2017 competition sled and our cut-away engine.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Holly stiner, Jason Ganje, Aaron Fleming, Carl Twyman, Charlie Stevens, Dyllan Barnum, Eric Oswald, Jacob Huppe, John Unterhalter, Joshua Bush, Lucas Miller, Nick Amato, Ron Stawnicy, Zane Williams

technologyQuarter.name: Steel Bridge Team
technologyQuarter.description: The Steel Bridge Team designs, fabricates, and builds a 1:10 scale bridge that must hold 2,500 pounds for a competition every April. The team is judged on the speed of its build at competition, the overall weight of the bridge, and how much it deflects under a 2,500 pound load. We will be doing one timed construction run at 1:00 pm, so come watch and check out the bridge we made for this year's competition!
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Christopher Powell, Brian Ringenwald, Kacey Rose, Brad Pozzi, Devin Vickery

technologyQuarter.name: Streaming Audio Signals Over Low-End Networks
technologyQuarter.description: The increase in the quality and quantity of sound-reproduction equipment found in homes today also means that audio may need to be streamed to multiple loudspeakers, not only the traditional right and left stereo speakers. Needless to say, setting up such an array can be cumbersome when wiring is involved. We aim to develop a wireless solution, where small, inexpensive embedded devices in each loudspeaker are able to communicate with an audio source to reproduce a signal intended for it.

technologyQuarter.name: The Construct @ RIT
technologyQuarter.description: The student makerspace at RIT, affectionately called The Construct came out of the desire for students from all colleges on campus to have a place and access to technology to work on personal innovative projects outside of curriculum. The Construct enables the RIT community to come together and make using tools like 3D printers, CNC and laser cutters. The space will be open during imagine to tour and ask questions about the equipment and see projects our makers are up, too.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Mike Buffalin, Evan Gallagher, Sarah Wittenauer, Ben Parnas, William Kommritz, MiKenzie Kusenberger, John Lawrence, Matt Ryan

technologyQuarter.name: VEX U Robotics Competition Team Demonstration
technologyQuarter.description: VEX Robotics Competition is an event that challenges College students to design & build a robot from the ground up in order to compete in a game against another College. This year's game is called StarStuck & involves picking up odd shaped objects & getting them to the opponents side of the field. The robots have to be able to work autonomously for 45 seconds & compete 1 v1 instead of in pairs. Stop by & see the robot our students have designed.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Holly Stiner, Christopher Brown, Shane Murphy, Sadiq Abdulrahman, Andy Lok

technologyQuarter.name: We're Ready for Science: Play & Art!
technologyQuarter.building: Center for Bioscience Education and Technology
technologyQuarter.ageRange: All ages, geared towards 3-10 year olds.
technologyQuarter.description: This exhibit is designed for children ages 3-10 and their families and provides a broad array of games, toys, activities and art projects that encourage informal (but foundational) learning. We have microscopes and drawing activities, fun toys that teach basic Physics concepts, some visual math games and a reading area with couches. It's a good place to play and also take a break!
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Elizabeth Perry, Rebecca Fletcher Roberts, Megan Hawkes, Aeris Maradeo, Maddi Dillabough, Rebekah Snitkoff, David Hartman, Maeve Wells, Brandon Lafever, Ashley Mayers, Lauren Harcum, Kristina Elmslie, Haleigh Mccloskey, Fateemah Saleem, Joshua Aldred, Abby Melake

technologyQuarter.name: What's Upcycling?
technologyQuarter.description: We represent SEAL, RIT's Student Environmental Action League. We focus on actions. Rather than simply telling you how to upcycle a bottle into a planter, we are going to do it with you! We want to get you involved in the process so that you can have a better understanding of why being able to do this is so important. While there are a lot of environmental actions that we could focus on, upcycling is currently one in need of attention.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Jeremy Clink, Abigail Frawley, Cassidy Goodwin, Ethan Koval, Annabel Sammons, Jonah Saitz, Ashley Wynne, Michaela Dow, Oksana Pliushko
